content.text:
Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.
            
What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits" 
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered
- Don't include generic development practices
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts. 
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```
I'll analyze the codebase to understand its structure and create a comprehensive CLAUDE.md file.

content.content:
1→# CLAUDE.md
     2→
     3→> **UV-Powered Agentic Development Environment** - Revolutionary Python packaging with modern tooling
     4→
     5→## Repository Overview
     6→
     7→This is a VS Code workspace template designed for UV-first Python development with comprehensive agentic coding capabilities. It provides a structured environment with Claude Code native integration, automated code review, template generation, and enterprise-grade documentation systems—all powered by Astral's UV for lightning-fast Python package management.
     8→
     9→## Core Commands
    10→
    11→- `/review --auto --focus=security,performance` - Enhanced code review with automation
    12→- `/prime --full` - Load comprehensive project context
    13→- `/process-template --template=prd-builder.md` - Generate professional documentation
    14→- Use `/help` to see all available commands
    15→
    16→## UV-Powered Development Commands
    17→
    18→This workspace exclusively uses UV for all Python packaging and project workflows:
    19→
    20→### JavaScript/Node.js Projects
    21→
    22→```bash
    23→# Initialize npm project
    24→npm init -y
    25→
    26→# Install dependencies
    27→npm install <package-name>
    28→
    29→# Run development server (if configured)
    30→npm run dev
    31→
    32→# Run tests (if configured)
    33→npm test
    34→
    35→# Build project (if configured)
    36→npm run build
    37→```
    38→
    39→### Python Projects (UV + pyproject.toml First)
    40→
    41→```bash
    42→# Initialize new UV project (creates pyproject.toml automatically)
    43→uv init my-project
    44→cd my-project
    45→
    46→# pyproject.toml is created with proper structure:
    47→# [project] section for dependencies
    48→# [tool.uv] section for UV-specific config
    49→# [build-system] for packaging
    50→
    51→# Add dependencies (updates pyproject.toml automatically)
    52→uv add requests fastapi pydantic
    53→
    54→# Add dev dependencies (adds to [tool.uv.dev-dependencies])
    55→uv add --dev pytest black ruff mypy
    56→
    57→# Add optional dependency groups (modern alternative to extras)
    58→uv add --group docs sphinx sphinx-rtd-theme
    59→uv add --group testing pytest-cov pytest-asyncio
    60→
    61→# Virtual environment creation (automatic with UV commands)
    62→uv venv  # Creates .venv/ directory
    63→# No manual activation needed with 'uv run'
    64→
    65→# Install project dependencies from pyproject.toml
    66→uv sync  # Installs [project.dependencies] + [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]
    67→uv sync --group docs  # Include specific groups
    68→uv sync --no-dev  # Production install (dependencies only)
    69→
    70→# Run Python scripts with UV (uses project environment automatically)
    71→uv run python src/main.py
    72→uv run python -m my_project  # If configured as module
    73→
    74→# Run tests with UV
    75→uv run pytest tests/
    76→uv run python -m pytest --cov=src
    77→
    78→# Dependency management through pyproject.toml
    79→uv lock  # Generate uv.lock from pyproject.toml
    80→uv sync --frozen  # Install exact versions from uv.lock
    81→uv lock --upgrade  # Update all dependencies in lockfile
    82→
    83→# Legacy requirements.txt support (compatibility only)
    84→uv pip install -r requirements.txt  # One-time migration
    85→uv export --format requirements-txt > requirements.txt  # Export for legacy systems
    86→```
    87→
    88→### Web Development
    89→
    90→- Use Live Server extension for HTML/CSS/JS development
    91→- Right-click on HTML file and select "Open with Live Server"
    92→
    93→## UV Migration Paths
    94→
    95→### From pip/pip-tools
    96→
    97→```bash
    98→# Modern approach: Convert to pyproject.toml (recommended)
    99→uv init  # Creates pyproject.toml structure
   100→
   101→# Add dependencies directly to pyproject.toml
   102→uv add requests flask pandas numpy
   103→
   104→# Add dev dependencies to [tool.uv.dev-dependencies] 
   105→uv add --dev pytest black ruff mypy
   106→
   107→# Legacy compatibility: Migrate existing requirements.txt (one-time)
   108→uv add $(cat requirements.txt | grep -v "^#" | grep -v "^$" | xargs)
   109→uv add --dev $(cat requirements-dev.txt | grep -v "^#" | grep -v "^$" | xargs)
   110→
   111→# Replace pip-compile workflow with UV lockfile
   112→uv lock  # Replaces pip-compile requirements.in → requirements.txt
   113→
   114→# Replace pip-sync workflow with UV sync
   115→uv sync  # Replaces pip-sync requirements.txt
   116→
   117→# Export to requirements.txt only if needed for legacy systems
   118→uv export --format requirements-txt > requirements.txt
   119→```
   120→
   121→### From Poetry
   122→
   123→```bash
   124→# Convert Poetry pyproject.toml to UV format (automatic detection)
   125→uv init  # UV reads existing Poetry config and converts
   126→
   127→# Or manual conversion of dependencies:
   128→# [tool.poetry.dependencies] → [project.dependencies]
   129→# [tool.poetry.group.dev.dependencies] → [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]
   130→
   131→# Replace Poetry commands with UV equivalents
   132→uv sync          # Replaces poetry install
   133→uv add package   # Replaces poetry add
   134→uv remove pkg    # Replaces poetry remove
   135→uv run cmd       # Replaces poetry run
   136→
   137→# Lockfile: uv.lock replaces poetry.lock
   138→# Both provide exact version pinning and cross-platform reproducibility
   139→```
   140→
   141→### From PDM
   142→
   143→```bash
   144→# Convert PDM pyproject.toml format to UV
   145→uv init  # UV can read PDM-style pyproject.toml
   146→
   147→# PDM to UV dependency mapping:
   148→# [project.dependencies] → [project.dependencies] (same!)
   149→# [project.optional-dependencies.dev] → [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]
   150→
   151→# Replace PDM commands
   152→uv sync          # Replaces pdm install
   153→uv add package   # Replaces pdm add
   154→uv run script    # Replaces pdm run
   155→
   156→# UV lockfile (uv.lock) replaces PDM lockfile (pdm.lock)
   157→```
   158→
   159→### From Hatch
   160→
   161→```bash
   162→# Hatch already uses pyproject.toml standard - easy conversion!
   163→uv init  # UV reads Hatch pyproject.toml format
   164→
   165→# Dependency groups conversion:
   166→# [project.optional-dependencies] can stay as-is
   167→# Or migrate to [tool.uv] sections for UV-specific features
   168→
   169→# Replace Hatch commands
   170→uv venv          # Replaces hatch env create
   171→uv sync          # Replaces hatch env sync
   172→uv run script    # Replaces hatch run
   173→```
   174→
   175→### From conda/mamba
   176→
   177→```bash
   178→# Convert conda environment.yml to pyproject.toml
   179→# (Manual process - conda uses different ecosystem)
   180→
   181→# 1. Export conda environment
   182→conda env export > environment.yml
   183→
   184→# 2. Create UV project with pyproject.toml
   185→uv init scientific-project
   186→cd scientific-project
   187→
   188→# 3. Add Python packages available on PyPI
   189→uv add numpy pandas scipy matplotlib seaborn scikit-learn jupyter
   190→
   191→# 4. For conda-only packages, document in README or use conda alongside UV
   192→# Example: Use conda for system libraries, UV for pure Python packages
   193→
   194→# 5. Set Python version in pyproject.toml
   195→uv python install 3.12
   196→uv python pin 3.12  # Creates .python-version file
   197→```
   198→
   199→## UV Configuration & Environment Variables
   200→
   201→### Global UV Configuration
   202→
   203→```bash
   204→# Set UV cache directory
   205→export UV_CACHE_DIR=~/.cache/uv
   206→
   207→# Configure UV Python preference
   208→export UV_PYTHON_PREFERENCE=only-managed
   209→
   210→# Set UV index URL (for private PyPI)
   211→export UV_INDEX_URL=https://pypi.org/simple/
   212→
   213→# Extra index URLs
   214→export UV_EXTRA_INDEX_URL=https://private.pypi.org/simple/
   215→
   216→# Disable UV progress bars in CI
   217→export UV_NO_PROGRESS=1
   218→
   219→# UV verbosity levels
   220→export UV_VERBOSE=1  # or 2 for more verbose output
   221→
   222→# Trust host for insecure connections
   223→export UV_TRUSTED_HOST=private.pypi.org
   224→
   225→# Configure concurrent downloads
   226→export UV_CONCURRENT_DOWNLOADS=4
   227→
   228→# Set timeout for network operations
   229→export UV_HTTP_TIMEOUT=30
   230→```
   231→
   232→### Project-Level UV Configuration (pyproject.toml)
   233→
   234→UV uses `pyproject.toml` as the single source of truth for project configuration:
   235→
   236→```toml
   237→[build-system]
   238→requires = ["hatchling"]
   239→build-backend = "hatchling.build"
   240→
   241→[project]
   242→name = "my-project"
   243→version = "0.1.0"
   244→description = "Modern Python project with UV"
   245→authors = [{name = "Your Name", email = "you@example.com"}]
   246→readme = "README.md"
   247→license = {text = "MIT"}
   248→requires-python = ">=3.9"
   249→
   250→# Runtime dependencies (equivalent to requirements.txt)
   251→dependencies = [
   252→    "requests>=2.31.0",
   253→    "pydantic>=2.0.0",
   254→    "fastapi>=0.100.0",
   255→]
   256→
   257→# Optional dependency groups (replaces requirements-dev.txt, requirements-docs.txt)
   258→[project.optional-dependencies]
   259→dev = [
   260→    "pytest>=7.0",
   261→    "ruff>=0.1.0", 
   262→    "mypy>=1.0",
   263→    "black>=22.0",
   264→]
   265→docs = [
   266→    "sphinx>=7.0",
   267→    "sphinx-rtd-theme",
   268→    "myst-parser",
   269→]
   270→test = [
   271→    "pytest-cov",
   272→    "pytest-asyncio",
   273→    "httpx",  # for testing FastAPI
   274→]
   275→
   276→# Project scripts (replaces setup.py entry_points)
   277→[project.scripts]
   278→my-app = "my_project.main:main"
   279→my-cli = "my_project.cli:cli_main"
   280→
   281→# UV-specific configuration
   282→[tool.uv]
   283→# Dev dependencies (UV extension - simpler than optional-dependencies)
   284→dev-dependencies = [
   285→    "pytest>=7.0",
   286→    "ruff>=0.1.0",
   287→    "mypy>=1.0",
   288→    "pre-commit>=3.0",
   289→]
   290→
   291→# Index configuration
   292→index-url = "https://pypi.org/simple/"
   293→extra-index-url = ["https://private.pypi.org/simple/"]
   294→
   295→# Workspace settings
   296→workspace = true
   297→generate-hashes = true
   298→
   299→# Tool configurations in pyproject.toml (single file approach)
   300→[tool.ruff]
   301→line-length = 100
   302→target-version = "py39"
   303→select = ["E", "F", "I", "N", "W", "UP"]
   304→
   305→[tool.mypy]
   306→python_version = "3.9"
   307→strict = true
   308→warn_return_any = true
   309→
   310→[tool.pytest.ini_options]
   311→testpaths = ["tests"]
   312→python_files = ["test_*.py"]
   313→addopts = "--cov=src --cov-report=term-missing"
   314→
   315→[tool.coverage.run]
   316→source = ["src"]
   317→omit = ["*/tests/*"]
   318→```

   650→## UV Performance & Caching Strategy
   651→
   652→### Lightning-Fast Installation Benefits
   653→
   654→UV achieves 10-100x faster package installation through:
   655→
   656→- **Parallel downloads**: Concurrent package fetching with connection pooling
   657→- **Zero-copy installs**: Direct extraction without intermediate copying
   658→- **Intelligent caching**: Global package cache with deduplication and compression
   659→- **Compiled resolver**: Rust-based dependency resolution engine
   660→- **Network optimization**: HTTP/2 support, compression, and smart retry logic
   661→- **Incremental operations**: Only process changes, not entire dependency trees
   662→
   663→### Global Cache Strategy
   664→
   665→```bash
   666→# Cache configuration (environment variables)
   667→export UV_CACHE_DIR=~/.cache/uv     # Default: ~/.cache/uv (Linux/macOS)
   668→export UV_NO_CACHE=1                # Disable caching (CI environments)
   669→export UV_CONCURRENT_DOWNLOADS=8    # Concurrent download limit (default: 4)
   670→
   671→# Cache inspection and management
   672→uv cache dir                        # Show cache directory location
   673→uv cache clean                      # Clear entire cache (nuclear option)
   674→uv cache clean numpy                # Clear specific package cache
   675→uv cache prune                      # Remove unused/stale cache entries
   676→```
   677→
   678→Cache structure and contents:
   679→
   680→```
   681→~/.cache/uv/
   682→├── builds/           # Compiled wheel cache from source distributions
   683→├── downloads/        # Raw downloaded packages (wheels, sdists)
   684→├── git/             # Git repository checkouts for VCS dependencies
   685→├── interpreted/     # Dependency resolution and metadata cache
   686→└── wheels/          # Built wheel cache (most important for speed)
   687→```
   688→
   689→### UV Lockfile Guarantees
   690→
   691→UV lockfiles (`uv.lock`) provide comprehensive reproducibility:
   692→
   693→**Security and Integrity:**
   694→
   695→- **SHA-256 hashes**: Every package verified against cryptographic hash
   696→- **Complete dependency tree**: Full transitive dependency resolution
   697→- **Source tracking**: Records exact source (PyPI, Git, local) for each package
   698→- **Platform specificity**: Separate resolution for different OS/architecture combinations
   699→
   700→**Build Reproducibility:**
   701→
   702→- **Exact version locking**: Pin to specific version, not ranges
   703→- **Build metadata**: Records build tools and environment requirements
   704→- **Environment markers**: Platform and Python version constraints
   705→- **Installation order**: Deterministic installation sequence
   706→
   707→Sample lockfile structure:
   708→
   709→```toml
   710→# uv.lock
   711→version = 1
   712→requires-python = ">=3.9"
   713→
   714→[[package]]
   715→name = "requests"
   716→version = "2.31.0"
   717→source = { registry = "https://pypi.org/simple" }
   718→dependencies = [
   719→    { name = "certifi" },
   720→    { name = "charset-normalizer" },
   721→    { name = "idna" },
   722→    { name = "urllib3" },
   723→]
   724→wheels = [
   725→    { url = "https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/.../requests-2.31.0-py3-none-any.whl", hash = "sha256:58cd2187c01e70e6e26505bca751777aa9f2ee0b7f4300988b709f44e013003f" },
   726→]
   727→
   728→[[package]]
   729→name = "certifi"  
   730→version = "2023.7.22"
   731→source = { registry = "https://pypi.org/simple" }
   732→wheels = [
   733→    { url = "https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/.../certifi-2023.7.22-py3-none-any.whl", hash = "sha256:92d6037539857d8206b8f6ae472e8b77db8058fec5937a1ef3f54304089edbb9" },
   734→]
   735→```

   923→# Automatic virtual environment creation and activation

   925→source .venv/bin/activate  # Linux/macOS: automatic with uv run
   926→# Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate
   927→
   928→# Add dependencies (replaces pip install)
   929→uv add requests pandas numpy
   930→uv add --dev pytest black ruff mypy
   931→
   932→# Install from legacy requirements.txt (one-time migration)
   933→uv add $(cat requirements.txt | grep -v "^#" | xargs)
   934→
   935→# Run Python scripts (replaces python script.py)
   936→uv run python src/main.py
   937→uv run src/main.py  # If configured in pyproject.toml [project.scripts]
   938→
   939→# Run tests (replaces python -m pytest)
   940→uv run pytest tests/
   941→uv run python -m pytest tests/ --cov=src
   942→
   943→# Development workflow
   944→uv run ruff check .        # Linting (replaces flake8/pylint)
   945→uv run ruff format .       # Formatting (replaces black) 
   946→uv run mypy src/           # Type checking
   947→uv run pytest --cov=src   # Testing with coverage
   948→
   949→# Dependency management
   950→uv add --upgrade requests  # Upgrade specific package
   951→uv lock --upgrade         # Upgrade all dependencies
   952→uv sync                   # Install exact lockfile dependencies
   953→uv remove unused-package  # Remove dependency
   954→
   955→# Environment reproduction
   956→uv sync --frozen          # Install exact lockfile (CI/CD)
   957→uv export --requirements-txt > requirements.txt  # Export for legacy systems
   958→```
   959→
   960→### Scientific Python Projects (UV + Science Stack)
   961→
   962→```bash
   963→# Initialize scientific project
   964→uv init --name scientific-project
   965→cd scientific-project
   966→
   967→# Add scientific computing stack
   968→uv add numpy pandas matplotlib seaborn scipy scikit-learn
   969→uv add --dev jupyter notebook ipykernel pytest
   970→
   971→# Jupyter integration
   972→uv run jupyter notebook
   973→uv run python -m ipykernel install --user --name=scientific-project
   974→
   975→# Run analysis scripts
   976→uv run python analysis/data_processing.py
   977→uv run python experiments/model_training.py
   978→
   979→# Package for distribution
   980→uv build
   981→uv publish  # To PyPI or private index
   982→```
   983→
   984→### Web Development (HTML/CSS/JS + Python Backend)
   985→
   986→```bash
   987→# Initialize full-stack project with UV backend
   988→uv init --name webapp-backend
   989→cd webapp-backend
   990→
   991→# Add web framework and dependencies
   992→uv add fastapi uvicorn[standard] jinja2 python-multipart
   993→uv add --dev pytest-asyncio httpx
   994→
   995→# Frontend assets (separate from UV)
   996→mkdir static templates
   997→# Use Live Server extension for HTML/CSS/JS development
   998→# Right-click on HTML file and select "Open with Live Server"
   999→
  1000→# Run development server
  1001→uv run uvicorn main:app --reload --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000
  1002→
  1003→# Production deployment
  1004→uv run gunicorn main:app -w 4 -k uvicorn.workers.UvicornWorker
  1005→```
  1006→
  1007→## Architecture Patterns
  1008→
  1009→### UV-First Agentic Development Framework
  1010→
  1011→Clean separation of concerns with UV at the core:
  1012→
  1013→- **`.claude/`** - Claude Code native integration (commands, agents, hooks, tools)
  1014→- **`pyproject.toml`** - UV project configuration and dependencies
  1015→- **`uv.lock`** - Reproducible dependency lockfile
  1016→- **`.python-version`** - Python version specification
  1017→- **`templates/`** - Reusable template system with variable substitution
  1018→- **`src/`** - Source code directory
  1019→- **`tests/`** - UV-managed test dependencies and files
  1020→- **`docs/`** - Documentation and examples
  1021→
  1022→### Multi-Language Support (UV-Enhanced)
  1023→
  1024→The framework supports:
  1025→
  1026→- **Python development** - UV-first with lightning-fast package management
  1027→- **JavaScript/TypeScript projects** - npm/yarn alongside UV
  1028→- **Web development** - UV backend with static frontend assets
  1029→- **Scientific computing** - UV + Jupyter + data science stack
  1030→- **General scripting** - UV for Python, native tools for others
  1031→
  1032→### Documentation-Driven Development
  1033→
  1034→Comprehensive documentation structure includes:
  1035→
  1036→- Technical architecture (`docs/ARCHITECTURE.md`)
  1037→- UV setup instructions (`docs/SETUP.md`)
  1038→- UV usage patterns (`docs/USAGE.md`)
  1039→- Feature documentation (`docs/FEATURES.md`)
  1040→- Contribution guidelines (`docs/CONTRIBUTING.md`)
  1041→
  1042→### Framework Organization
  1043→
  1044→- **Commands** in `.claude/commands/` - Claude Code slash commands
  1045→- **Tools** in `.claude/tools/` - Auto-fix engines, UV integrations
  1046→- **Agents** in `.claude/agents/` - Specialized agent definitions
  1047→- **Templates** in `templates/builders/` - Clean template system
  1048→- **Hooks** in `.claude/hooks/` - UV workflow automation
  1049→- **UV Configuration** in `pyproject.toml` - Modern Python project config
  1050→
  1051→## Key Features
  1052→
  1053→- Zero-configuration UV setup for new Python developers
  1054→- Lightning-fast automated package management with caching
  1055→- Performance-optimized VS Code settings with UV integration
  1056→- **Modular template system** with variable substitution
  1057→- **Command automation** for UV-powered development workflows
  1058→- **Enterprise-grade documentation** generation
  1059→- **🚀 REVOLUTIONARY: Review-driven implementation system**
  1060→- **🤖 Automated code improvement** with intelligent analysis
  1061→- **🔧 Auto-fix engine** for security and performance issues
  1062→- **⚡ UV-First Python**: 10-100x faster than pip/Poetry/PDM
  1063→- Multi-project workspace support with UV monorepo capabilities
  1064→- Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux)
  1065→- **🔒 Reproducible builds** with UV lockfiles and hashing
  1066→- **🐍 Modern Python toolchain** - UV + Ruff + mypy integration
  1067→
  1068→## Claude Code Behavioral Guidelines
  1069→
  1070→### Decision Making
  1071→
  1072→- **When plans exist, execute them** - Check ROADMAP.md, validation checklists, and documentation first
  1073→- **Only ask for direction when plans are unclear or missing** - Don't create decision paralysis when next steps are documented
  1074→- **Follow the "Great Planning = Great Prompting" principle** - Respect existing planning work
  1075→
  1076→### Execution Priority
  1077→
  1078→1. Check existing plans/roadmaps/documentation
  1079→2. If clear next step exists, proceed immediately
  1080→3. Only prompt for direction when genuinely ambiguous
  1081→
  1082→### Systematic File Creation (CRITICAL)
  1083→
  1084→**NEVER output important analysis, frameworks, or actionable information solely in chat. Always create permanent files for knowledge that should be preserved, referenced, or acted upon.**
  1085→
  1086→#### Mandatory File Creation Triggers
  1087→
  1088→**Before providing substantial content, STOP and create files FIRST if ANY of these apply:**
  1089→
  1090→- Analysis requiring >3 paragraphs of explanation
  1091→- Any framework or architecture description  
  1092→- Step-by-step processes with >5 steps
  1093→- Multiple interconnected concepts or solutions
  1094→- Information that took >10 minutes of thinking to develop
  1095→- Problem definitions → `ISSUES/{Problem-Name}.md`
  1096→- Solution frameworks → `FRAMEWORK/{Solution-Name}-Architecture.md`
  1097→- Implementation plans → `PROCESS/{Process-Name}-Implementation.md`
  1098→- Success criteria → `METRICS/{Area-Name}-Success-Criteria.md`
  1099→- Behavioral guidelines → `BEHAVIORAL/{Guideline-Name}-Guidelines.md`
  1100→- Analysis results → `ANALYSIS/{Topic-Name}-Analysis.md`
  1101→
  1102→#### File Creation Workflow
  1103→
  1104→1. **Recognize trigger** - Check if content meets file creation criteria
  1105→2. **Create appropriate file** with descriptive naming and proper structure
  1106→3. **Provide chat summary** - Brief overview with file reference
  1107→4. **Track with TodoWrite** - Include file creation in task management
  1108→
  1109→#### Chat vs. File Decision Matrix
  1110→
  1111→- **Chat appropriate**: Quick clarifications, status updates, simple confirmations
  1112→- **File required**: Problem analysis, solution frameworks, implementation plans, success metrics, behavioral guidelines, process workflows
  1113→
  1114→**Reference:** See `BEHAVIORAL/Systematic-File-Creation-Guidelines.md` for complete implementation details.
  1115→
  1116→## Getting Started with UV
  1117→
  1118→1. **Install UV**: `curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh` (or Windows PowerShell installer)
  1119→2. **Open workspace**: `code code.code-workspace` in VS Code
  1120→3. **Initialize UV project**: `uv init` (creates pyproject.toml, .python-version)
  1121→4. **Claude Code auto-loads** project context via session hooks
  1122→5. **Start development**: `uv add requests` → `uv run python src/main.py`
  1123→6. **Enhanced review**: `/review --auto --fix` for intelligent analysis
  1124→7. **Context loading**: `/prime --full` for comprehensive understanding
  1125→8. **Documentation**: `/process-template --template=prd-builder.md`
  1126→
  1127→### Quick Start Tour (UV + pyproject.toml First)
  1128→
  1129→```bash
  1130→# Install UV (one-time setup)
  1131→curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
  1132→
  1133→# Create new project with pyproject.toml structure
  1134→uv init my-awesome-project
  1135→cd my-awesome-project
  1136→
  1137→# pyproject.toml is automatically created with:
  1138→# - [project] section for metadata and dependencies
  1139→# - [tool.uv] section for UV-specific configuration
  1140→# - [build-system] section for packaging
  1141→
  1142→# Add dependencies (updates pyproject.toml automatically)
  1143→uv add fastapi uvicorn requests pandas
  1144→
  1145→# Add development dependencies to [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]
  1146→uv add --dev pytest black ruff mypy
  1147→
  1148→# Add optional dependency groups
  1149→uv add --group docs sphinx sphinx-rtd-theme
  1150→uv add --group test pytest-cov httpx
  1151→
  1152→# Install all dependencies from pyproject.toml
  1153→uv sync  # Installs [project.dependencies] + [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]
  1154→
  1155→# Run your application (using project environment automatically)
  1156→uv run python src/main.py
  1157→
  1158→# Development workflow with pyproject.toml tools
  1159→uv run pytest              # Run tests
  1160→uv run ruff check .        # Lint code  
  1161→uv run ruff format .       # Format code
  1162→uv run mypy src/           # Type check
  1163→
  1164→# Generate/sync lockfile from pyproject.toml
  1165→uv lock    # Creates uv.lock with exact versions
  1166→uv sync --frozen  # Install exact lockfile versions (CI/production)
  1167→
  1168→# === Claude Code Integration ===
  1169→# Load context and understand the project
  1170→/prime --full
  1171→
  1172→# Run enhanced review with automation  
  1173→/review --auto --fix
  1174→
  1175→# Process templates for documentation
  1176→/process-template --template=prd-builder.md
  1177→
  1178→# === Legacy Compatibility (when needed) ===
  1179→# Export pyproject.toml dependencies to requirements.txt (for legacy systems)
  1180→uv export --format requirements-txt > requirements.txt
  1181→
  1182→# One-time migration from existing requirements.txt to pyproject.toml
  1183→uv add $(cat requirements.txt | grep -v "^#" | grep -v "^$" | xargs)
  1184→```
  1185→
  1186→## UV Installation Reference
  1187→
  1188→### Universal Installation (Recommended)
  1189→
  1190→```bash
  1191→# macOS and Linux
  1192→curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
  1193→
  1194→# Windows PowerShell  
  1195→powershell -c "irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex"
  1196→
  1197→# Verify installation
  1198→uv --version
  1199→```
  1200→
  1201→### Alternative Installation Methods
  1202→
  1203→```bash
  1204→# Package managers
  1205→brew install uv                    # macOS Homebrew
  1206→pacman -S uv                      # Arch Linux  
  1207→sudo apt install uv               # Ubuntu/Debian (after adding Astral repo)
  1208→dnf install uv                    # Fedora/RHEL
  1209→
  1210→# Python-based (bootstrapping)
  1211→pip install uv                    # Using pip
  1212→pipx install uv                   # Using pipx (isolated)
  1213→
  1214→# From source (development)
  1215→cargo install --git https://github.com/astral-sh/uv
  1216→```
  1217→
  1218→### Post-Installation Setup
  1219→
  1220→```bash
  1221→# Add to shell profile for PATH (if not automatic)
  1222→echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bashrc
  1223→source ~/.bashrc
  1224→
  1225→# Verify and configure
  1226→uv --version
  1227→uv python list                    # List available Python versions
  1228→uv python install 3.11           # Install preferred Python version
  1229→
  1230→# Global configuration (optional)
  1231→export UV_CACHE_DIR=~/.cache/uv
  1232→export UV_PYTHON_PREFERENCE=only-managed
  1233→```
  1234→
  1235→## Additional Resources
  1236→
  1237→- **[UV Documentation](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/)** - Official comprehensive documentation
  1238→- **[UV GitHub Repository](https://github.com/astral-sh/uv)** - Source code and issue tracking
  1239→- **[Project Roadmap](ROADMAP.md)** - Future development plans

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

> **UV-Powered Agentic Development Environment** - Revolutionary Python packaging with modern tooling

## Repository Overview

This is a VS Code workspace template designed for UV-first Python development with comprehensive agentic coding capabilities. It provides a structured environment with Claude Code native integration, automated code review, template generation, and enterprise-grade documentation systems—all powered by Astral's UV for lightning-fast Python package management.

## Core Commands

- `/review --auto --focus=security,performance` - Enhanced code review with automation
- `/prime --full` - Load comprehensive project context
- `/process-template --template=prd-builder.md` - Generate professional documentation
- Use `/help` to see all available commands

## UV-Powered Development Commands

This workspace exclusively uses UV for all Python packaging and project workflows:

### JavaScript/Node.js Projects

```bash
# Initialize npm project
npm init -y

# Install dependencies
npm install <package-name>

# Run development server (if configured)
npm run dev

# Run tests (if configured)
npm test

# Build project (if configured)
npm run build
```

### Python Projects (UV + pyproject.toml First)

```bash
# Initialize new UV project (creates pyproject.toml automatically)
uv init my-project
cd my-project

# pyproject.toml is created with proper structure:
# [project] section for dependencies
# [tool.uv] section for UV-specific config
# [build-system] for packaging

# Add dependencies (updates pyproject.toml automatically)
uv add requests fastapi pydantic

# Add dev dependencies (adds to [tool.uv.dev-dependencies])
uv add --dev pytest black ruff mypy

# Add optional dependency groups (modern alternative to extras)
uv add --group docs sphinx sphinx-rtd-theme
uv add --group testing pytest-cov pytest-asyncio

# Virtual environment creation (automatic with UV commands)
uv venv  # Creates .venv/ directory
# No manual activation needed with 'uv run'

# Install project dependencies from pyproject.toml
uv sync  # Installs [project.dependencies] + [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]
uv sync --group docs  # Include specific groups
uv sync --no-dev  # Production install (dependencies only)

# Run Python scripts with UV (uses project environment automatically)
uv run python src/main.py
uv run python -m my_project  # If configured as module

# Run tests with UV
uv run pytest tests/
uv run python -m pytest --cov=src

# Dependency management through pyproject.toml
uv lock  # Generate uv.lock from pyproject.toml
uv sync --frozen  # Install exact versions from uv.lock
uv lock --upgrade  # Update all dependencies in lockfile

# Legacy requirements.txt support (compatibility only)
uv pip install -r requirements.txt  # One-time migration
uv export --format requirements-txt > requirements.txt  # Export for legacy systems
```

### Web Development

- Use Live Server extension for HTML/CSS/JS development
- Right-click on HTML file and select "Open with Live Server"

## UV Migration Paths

### From pip/pip-tools

```bash
# Modern approach: Convert to pyproject.toml (recommended)
uv init  # Creates pyproject.toml structure

# Add dependencies directly to pyproject.toml
uv add requests flask pandas numpy

# Add dev dependencies to [tool.uv.dev-dependencies] 
uv add --dev pytest black ruff mypy

# Legacy compatibility: Migrate existing requirements.txt (one-time)
uv add $(cat requirements.txt | grep -v "^#" | grep -v "^$" | xargs)
uv add --dev $(cat requirements-dev.txt | grep -v "^#" | grep -v "^$" | xargs)

# Replace pip-compile workflow with UV lockfile
uv lock  # Replaces pip-compile requirements.in → requirements.txt

# Replace pip-sync workflow with UV sync
uv sync  # Replaces pip-sync requirements.txt

# Export to requirements.txt only if needed for legacy systems
uv export --format requirements-txt > requirements.txt
```

### From Poetry

```bash
# Convert Poetry pyproject.toml to UV format (automatic detection)
uv init  # UV reads existing Poetry config and converts

# Or manual conversion of dependencies:
# [tool.poetry.dependencies] → [project.dependencies]
# [tool.poetry.group.dev.dependencies] → [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]

# Replace Poetry commands with UV equivalents
uv sync          # Replaces poetry install
uv add package   # Replaces poetry add
uv remove pkg    # Replaces poetry remove
uv run cmd       # Replaces poetry run

# Lockfile: uv.lock replaces poetry.lock
# Both provide exact version pinning and cross-platform reproducibility
```

### From PDM

```bash
# Convert PDM pyproject.toml format to UV
uv init  # UV can read PDM-style pyproject.toml

# PDM to UV dependency mapping:
# [project.dependencies] → [project.dependencies] (same!)
# [project.optional-dependencies.dev] → [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]

# Replace PDM commands
uv sync          # Replaces pdm install
uv add package   # Replaces pdm add
uv run script    # Replaces pdm run

# UV lockfile (uv.lock) replaces PDM lockfile (pdm.lock)
```

### From Hatch

```bash
# Hatch already uses pyproject.toml standard - easy conversion!
uv init  # UV reads Hatch pyproject.toml format

# Dependency groups conversion:
# [project.optional-dependencies] can stay as-is
# Or migrate to [tool.uv] sections for UV-specific features

# Replace Hatch commands
uv venv          # Replaces hatch env create
uv sync          # Replaces hatch env sync
uv run script    # Replaces hatch run
```

### From conda/mamba

```bash
# Convert conda environment.yml to pyproject.toml
# (Manual process - conda uses different ecosystem)

# 1. Export conda environment
conda env export > environment.yml

# 2. Create UV project with pyproject.toml
uv init scientific-project
cd scientific-project

# 3. Add Python packages available on PyPI
uv add numpy pandas scipy matplotlib seaborn scikit-learn jupyter

# 4. For conda-only packages, document in README or use conda alongside UV
# Example: Use conda for system libraries, UV for pure Python packages

# 5. Set Python version in pyproject.toml
uv python install 3.12
uv python pin 3.12  # Creates .python-version file
```

## UV Configuration & Environment Variables

### Global UV Configuration

```bash
# Set UV cache directory
export UV_CACHE_DIR=~/.cache/uv

# Configure UV Python preference
export UV_PYTHON_PREFERENCE=only-managed

# Set UV index URL (for private PyPI)
export UV_INDEX_URL=https://pypi.org/simple/

# Extra index URLs
export UV_EXTRA_INDEX_URL=https://private.pypi.org/simple/

# Disable UV progress bars in CI
export UV_NO_PROGRESS=1

# UV verbosity levels
export UV_VERBOSE=1  # or 2 for more verbose output

# Trust host for insecure connections
export UV_TRUSTED_HOST=private.pypi.org

# Configure concurrent downloads
export UV_CONCURRENT_DOWNLOADS=4

# Set timeout for network operations
export UV_HTTP_TIMEOUT=30
```

### Project-Level UV Configuration (pyproject.toml)

UV uses `pyproject.toml` as the single source of truth for project configuration:

```toml
[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

[project]
name = "my-project"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Modern Python project with UV"
authors = [{name = "Your Name", email = "you@example.com"}]
readme = "README.md"
license = {text = "MIT"}
requires-python = ">=3.9"

# Runtime dependencies (equivalent to requirements.txt)
dependencies = [
    "requests>=2.31.0",
    "pydantic>=2.0.0",
    "fastapi>=0.100.0",
]

# Optional dependency groups (replaces requirements-dev.txt, requirements-docs.txt)
[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=7.0",
    "ruff>=0.1.0", 
    "mypy>=1.0",
    "black>=22.0",
]
docs = [
    "sphinx>=7.0",
    "sphinx-rtd-theme",
    "myst-parser",
]
test = [
    "pytest-cov",
    "pytest-asyncio",
    "httpx",  # for testing FastAPI
]

# Project scripts (replaces setup.py entry_points)
[project.scripts]
my-app = "my_project.main:main"
my-cli = "my_project.cli:cli_main"

# UV-specific configuration
[tool.uv]
# Dev dependencies (UV extension - simpler than optional-dependencies)
dev-dependencies = [
    "pytest>=7.0",
    "ruff>=0.1.0",
    "mypy>=1.0",
    "pre-commit>=3.0",
]

# Index configuration
index-url = "https://pypi.org/simple/"
extra-index-url = ["https://private.pypi.org/simple/"]

# Workspace settings
workspace = true
generate-hashes = true

# Tool configurations in pyproject.toml (single file approach)
[tool.ruff]
line-length = 100
target-version = "py39"
select = ["E", "F", "I", "N", "W", "UP"]

[tool.mypy]
python_version = "3.9"
strict = true
warn_return_any = true

[tool.pytest.ini_options]
testpaths = ["tests"]
python_files = ["test_*.py"]
addopts = "--cov=src --cov-report=term-missing"

[tool.coverage.run]
source = ["src"]
omit = ["*/tests/*"]
```

## Code Standards

- **Indentation:** 2 spaces (no tabs)
- **Line length:** 100 characters maximum  
- **Naming:** camelCase for variables, PascalCase for classes
- **Documentation:** JSDoc for functions, README for modules
- **Testing:** UV + pytest with 80+ coverage minimum
- **Python formatting:** UV + ruff for linting and formatting
- **Dependency management:** UV for all Python package operations

## UV Project Structure

### Single UV Project Layout

```
my-project/
├── .claude/                 # Claude Code native integration
│   ├── commands/            # Native slash commands
│   ├── agents/              # Specialized agents
│   ├── hooks/               # Automation hooks
│   ├── tools/               # Auto-fix engines
│   └── settings.json        # Team configuration
├── pyproject.toml           # UV project configuration & dependencies
├── uv.lock                  # UV lockfile for reproducible installs
├── .python-version          # Python version specification
├── src/                     # Source code
│   └── my_project/
│       ├── __init__.py
│       └── main.py
├── tests/                   # Test files (UV managed)
│   └── test_main.py
├── templates/               # Template system
│   └── builders/            # Template builders
├── examples/                # Usage examples
└── docs/                    # Documentation
```

### UV Monorepo/Workspace Layout

```
workspace-root/
├── pyproject.toml           # Workspace root configuration
├── uv.lock                  # Shared lockfile
├── .python-version          # Global Python version
├── packages/
│   ├── core/
│   │   ├── pyproject.toml   # Core package config
│   │   └── src/core/
│   ├── api/
│   │   ├── pyproject.toml   # API package config  
│   │   └── src/api/
│   └── cli/
│       ├── pyproject.toml   # CLI package config
│       └── src/cli/
├── .claude/                 # Shared Claude integration
└── docs/                    # Shared documentation
```

## UV Workspace Layouts

### Single Project Configuration (pyproject.toml)

```toml
[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

[project]
name = "my-project"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "UV-powered Python project"
authors = [{name = "Your Name", email = "you@example.com"}]
dependencies = [
    "requests>=2.31.0",
    "pydantic>=2.0.0",
]
requires-python = ">=3.9"

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=7.0",
    "ruff>=0.1.0", 
    "mypy>=1.0",
    "black>=22.0",
]
docs = [
    "sphinx>=7.0",
    "sphinx-rtd-theme",
]

[project.scripts]
my-project = "my_project.main:main"

[tool.uv]
dev-dependencies = [
    "pytest>=7.0",
    "ruff>=0.1.0",
    "mypy>=1.0", 
    "black>=22.0",
]

[tool.ruff]
line-length = 100
target-version = "py39"

[tool.mypy]
python_version = "3.9"
strict = true
```

### Workspace Root Configuration (pyproject.toml)

```toml
[tool.uv.workspace]
members = [
    "packages/core",
    "packages/api", 
    "packages/cli"
]

[tool.uv]
dev-dependencies = [
    "pytest>=7.0",
    "ruff>=0.1.0",
    "mypy>=1.0",
    "pre-commit>=3.0",
]

# Shared dependency constraints
[[tool.uv.constraint]]
requests = ">=2.31.0"
pydantic = ">=2.0.0"
```

## UV Development Environment

### VS Code Configuration

The workspace includes UV-optimized settings:

- Auto-save enabled (1-second delay)
- Format on save with Ruff (UV-compatible)
- Tab size: 2 spaces for JS/TS, 4 spaces for Python
- Auto-fix code issues on save with Ruff
- Optimized file exclusions for performance (includes `.venv/` and `uv.lock`)

### Recommended Extensions for UV Development

- **Python Support** - Full Python development with UV integration
- **Ruff** - Lightning-fast Python linting and formatting (UV ecosystem)
- **JSON Language Features** - For pyproject.toml editing
- **TOML Language Support** - Enhanced pyproject.toml editing
- **Prettier Code Formatter** - For non-Python files
- **TypeScript/JavaScript Support** - For mixed language projects
- **Live Server** - For web development

### UV Extension Integration

VS Code settings for UV:

```json
{
  "python.defaultInterpreterPath": ".venv/bin/python",
  "python.terminal.activateEnvironment": true,
  "ruff.organizeImports": true,
  "ruff.fixAll": true,
  "[python]": {
    "editor.defaultFormatter": "charliermarsh.ruff",
    "editor.codeActionsOnSave": {
      "source.organizeImports": "explicit",
      "source.fixAll": "explicit"
    }
  }
}
```

## UV CLI Commands Reference

### Core Project Commands

```bash
# Project initialization
uv init [project-name]              # Create new project
uv init --app                       # Create application project
uv init --lib                       # Create library project  
uv init --workspace                 # Create workspace root

# Python management
uv python list                      # List available Python versions
uv python install 3.12             # Install specific Python version
uv python pin 3.11                 # Pin project to Python version
uv python find                      # Find Python installations

# Virtual environment management
uv venv [name]                      # Create virtual environment
uv venv --python 3.11              # Create with specific Python
uv venv --seed                      # Create with pip/setuptools
uv venv --system-site-packages     # Include system packages
```

### Package Management Commands

```bash
# Adding dependencies
uv add package-name                 # Add runtime dependency
uv add --dev pytest                # Add development dependency
uv add --group docs sphinx          # Add to named dependency group
uv add --editable ./local-package   # Add local editable package
uv add --index-url URL package      # Add from specific index
uv add --git https://github.com/user/repo.git  # Add from Git
uv add --path ./local-path          # Add local package

# Removing dependencies
uv remove package-name              # Remove dependency
uv remove --dev pytest             # Remove dev dependency
uv remove --group docs sphinx       # Remove from named group

# Upgrading dependencies
uv add --upgrade package-name       # Upgrade specific package
uv lock --upgrade                   # Upgrade all dependencies
uv lock --upgrade-package requests  # Upgrade specific package
```

### Installation and Environment Sync

```bash
# Environment synchronization
uv sync                             # Install lockfile dependencies
uv sync --dev                      # Include dev dependencies
uv sync --group docs               # Include named group
uv sync --no-dev                   # Exclude dev dependencies
uv sync --frozen                   # Don't update lockfile
uv sync --all-groups              # Include all dependency groups

# Lockfile management
uv lock                            # Generate/update lockfile
uv lock --dry-run                  # Preview lockfile changes
uv lock --resolution lowest        # Use lowest compatible versions
uv lock --resolution highest       # Use highest compatible versions
```

### Running Commands and Scripts

```bash
# Running Python with project environment
uv run python script.py            # Run script with project environment
uv run --group dev pytest          # Run with specific dependency group
uv run --with requests python -c "import requests"  # Run with temporary dependency
uv run --python 3.11 script.py     # Run with specific Python version

# Project scripts (defined in pyproject.toml [project.scripts])
uv run my-script                    # Run project-defined script
uv run --no-project python script.py  # Run without project context
```

### Tool Management (Global Packages)

```bash
# Global tool installation
uv tool install black              # Install global tool
uv tool install --python 3.11 black  # Install with specific Python
uv tool install --from git+https://github.com/user/tool.git  # From Git

# Running tools
uv tool run black .                # Run tool temporarily
uv tool run --from black black .   # Run specific version temporarily
uv tool run --python 3.11 black . # Run with specific Python

# Tool management
uv tool list                       # List installed tools
uv tool uninstall black            # Remove global tool
uv tool upgrade black              # Upgrade global tool
uv tool upgrade --all             # Upgrade all global tools
```

### Build and Publishing

```bash
# Building packages
uv build                           # Build wheel and sdist
uv build --wheel                   # Build wheel only
uv build --sdist                   # Build source distribution only
uv build --out-dir custom-dir      # Build to custom directory

# Publishing packages
uv publish                         # Publish to PyPI
uv publish --index-url URL         # Publish to custom index
uv publish --username user --password pass  # With credentials
uv publish dist/*.whl              # Publish specific files
```

### Cache and Performance

```bash
# Cache management
uv cache clean                      # Clear entire cache
uv cache clean package-name         # Clear specific package cache
uv cache dir                       # Show cache directory path
uv cache prune                     # Remove unused cache entries

# Performance and debugging
uv --verbose run python script.py  # Verbose output
uv --quiet add package-name        # Suppress output
uv --no-cache add package-name     # Skip cache for operation
uv --offline add package-name      # Use only cached packages
```

### Legacy pip Interface

```bash
# pip-compatible commands (for migration)
uv pip install package-name        # pip-compatible install
uv pip install -r requirements.txt # Install from requirements
uv pip list                        # List installed packages
uv pip freeze                      # Generate requirements
uv pip show package-name           # Show package information
uv pip uninstall package-name     # Uninstall package
uv pip check                       # Verify package dependencies
```

### Self-Management

```bash
# UV self-management
uv self update                     # Update UV to latest version
uv version                         # Show UV version
uv help                           # Show help information
uv help add                       # Show help for specific command
```

## UV Performance & Caching Strategy

### Lightning-Fast Installation Benefits

UV achieves 10-100x faster package installation through:

- **Parallel downloads**: Concurrent package fetching with connection pooling
- **Zero-copy installs**: Direct extraction without intermediate copying
- **Intelligent caching**: Global package cache with deduplication and compression
- **Compiled resolver**: Rust-based dependency resolution engine
- **Network optimization**: HTTP/2 support, compression, and smart retry logic
- **Incremental operations**: Only process changes, not entire dependency trees

### Global Cache Strategy

```bash
# Cache configuration (environment variables)
export UV_CACHE_DIR=~/.cache/uv     # Default: ~/.cache/uv (Linux/macOS)
export UV_NO_CACHE=1                # Disable caching (CI environments)
export UV_CONCURRENT_DOWNLOADS=8    # Concurrent download limit (default: 4)

# Cache inspection and management
uv cache dir                        # Show cache directory location
uv cache clean                      # Clear entire cache (nuclear option)
uv cache clean numpy                # Clear specific package cache
uv cache prune                      # Remove unused/stale cache entries
```

Cache structure and contents:

```
~/.cache/uv/
├── builds/           # Compiled wheel cache from source distributions
├── downloads/        # Raw downloaded packages (wheels, sdists)
├── git/             # Git repository checkouts for VCS dependencies
├── interpreted/     # Dependency resolution and metadata cache
└── wheels/          # Built wheel cache (most important for speed)
```

### UV Lockfile Guarantees

UV lockfiles (`uv.lock`) provide comprehensive reproducibility:

**Security and Integrity:**

- **SHA-256 hashes**: Every package verified against cryptographic hash
- **Complete dependency tree**: Full transitive dependency resolution
- **Source tracking**: Records exact source (PyPI, Git, local) for each package
- **Platform specificity**: Separate resolution for different OS/architecture combinations

**Build Reproducibility:**

- **Exact version locking**: Pin to specific version, not ranges
- **Build metadata**: Records build tools and environment requirements
- **Environment markers**: Platform and Python version constraints
- **Installation order**: Deterministic installation sequence

Sample lockfile structure:

```toml
# uv.lock
version = 1
requires-python = ">=3.9"

[[package]]
name = "requests"
version = "2.31.0"
source = { registry = "https://pypi.org/simple" }
dependencies = [
    { name = "certifi" },
    { name = "charset-normalizer" },
    { name = "idna" },
    { name = "urllib3" },
]
wheels = [
    { url = "https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/.../requests-2.31.0-py3-none-any.whl", hash = "sha256:58cd2187c01e70e6e26505bca751777aa9f2ee0b7f4300988b709f44e013003f" },
]

[[package]]
name = "certifi"  
version = "2023.7.22"
source = { registry = "https://pypi.org/simple" }
wheels = [
    { url = "https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/.../certifi-2023.7.22-py3-none-any.whl", hash = "sha256:92d6037539857d8206b8f6ae472e8b77db8058fec5937a1ef3f54304089edbb9" },
]
```

### UV in CI/CD Environments

Optimized CI configuration:

```yaml
# GitHub Actions example
name: Python CI with UV
on: [push, pull_request]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Install UV
      run: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
      
    - name: Setup Python
      run: uv python install 3.11
      
    - name: Create environment and install dependencies
      run: |
        uv sync --frozen  # Use exact lockfile, don't update
        
    - name: Run tests
      run: uv run pytest
      
    - name: Run linting
      run: |
        uv run ruff check .
        uv run mypy .
      
    env:
      UV_NO_PROGRESS: 1      # Disable progress bars in CI
      UV_CACHE_DIR: ~/.cache/uv  # Explicit cache location for caching
```

### UV Zero-to-Production Installation

**Universal installer (recommended):**

```bash
# One-liner installation (macOS/Linux)
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

# Windows PowerShell
powershell -c "irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex"

# Verify installation
uv --version
```

**Package manager installation:**

```bash
# macOS Homebrew
brew install uv

# Linux package managers
# Arch Linux
pacman -S uv

# Ubuntu/Debian (add Astral repository first)
sudo apt update && sudo apt install uv

# Fedora/RHEL
dnf install uv
```

**Python-based installation (fallback):**

```bash
# Using pip (ironic, but works for bootstrapping)
pip install uv

# Using pipx (isolated installation)
pipx install uv
```

**Docker integration:**

```dockerfile
# Dockerfile example
FROM python:3.11-slim

# Install UV
COPY --from=ghcr.io/astral-sh/uv:latest /uv /bin/uv

# Set up project
WORKDIR /app
COPY pyproject.toml uv.lock ./
RUN uv sync --frozen

# Copy source and run
COPY . .
CMD ["uv", "run", "python", "-m", "myapp"]
```

## Command Ecosystem

Native Claude Code commands for enhanced development workflows:

- **`/review`** - Enterprise-grade code analysis with automation
  - `--auto` - Full automation pipeline (review → fix → template → track)
  - `--fix` - Apply safe automated improvements
  - `--implement` - Generate implementation templates
  - `--focus=security,performance` - Targeted analysis areas

- **`/prime`** - Universal context loading system
  - `--full` - Load comprehensive project context
  - `--minimal` - Essential context only

- **`/process-template`** - Dynamic document generation
  - `--template=prd-builder.md` - Product requirements
  - `--template=technical-design-builder.md` - Architecture docs
  - `--template=api-specification-builder.md` - API documentation

## Agent System

Specialized agents for complex task orchestration:

- **Auto-Fix Specialist** (`.claude/agents/auto-fix-specialist.md`)
  - Safe automated code improvements
  - Security vulnerability fixes
  - Performance optimizations
  - Rollback capabilities

- **Template Processor** (`.claude/agents/template-processor.md`)

## Revolutionary Features

- **Agent Orchestration** - Specialized agents in `.claude/agents/`
- **Auto-Fix Engine** - Security and performance tools in `.claude/tools/`
- **Template Generation** - Professional docs with variable substitution
- **UV-First Python** - Lightning-fast package management and dependency resolution

## UV-Powered Development Commands

When adding specific language projects:

### JavaScript/Node.js Projects (Unchanged)

```bash
# Initialize npm project
npm init -y

# Install dependencies
npm install <package-name>

# Run development server (if configured)
npm run dev

# Run tests (if configured)
npm test

# Build project (if configured)
npm run build
```

### Python Projects (UV-Exclusive)

```bash
# Initialize new UV project (replaces ALL legacy Python workflows)
uv init my-project
cd my-project

# Automatic virtual environment creation and activation
uv venv
source .venv/bin/activate  # Linux/macOS: automatic with uv run
# Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate

# Add dependencies (replaces pip install)
uv add requests pandas numpy
uv add --dev pytest black ruff mypy

# Install from legacy requirements.txt (one-time migration)
uv add $(cat requirements.txt | grep -v "^#" | xargs)

# Run Python scripts (replaces python script.py)
uv run python src/main.py
uv run src/main.py  # If configured in pyproject.toml [project.scripts]

# Run tests (replaces python -m pytest)
uv run pytest tests/
uv run python -m pytest tests/ --cov=src

# Development workflow
uv run ruff check .        # Linting (replaces flake8/pylint)
uv run ruff format .       # Formatting (replaces black) 
uv run mypy src/           # Type checking
uv run pytest --cov=src   # Testing with coverage

# Dependency management
uv add --upgrade requests  # Upgrade specific package
uv lock --upgrade         # Upgrade all dependencies
uv sync                   # Install exact lockfile dependencies
uv remove unused-package  # Remove dependency

# Environment reproduction
uv sync --frozen          # Install exact lockfile (CI/CD)
uv export --requirements-txt > requirements.txt  # Export for legacy systems
```

### Scientific Python Projects (UV + Science Stack)

```bash
# Initialize scientific project
uv init --name scientific-project
cd scientific-project

# Add scientific computing stack
uv add numpy pandas matplotlib seaborn scipy scikit-learn
uv add --dev jupyter notebook ipykernel pytest

# Jupyter integration
uv run jupyter notebook
uv run python -m ipykernel install --user --name=scientific-project

# Run analysis scripts
uv run python analysis/data_processing.py
uv run python experiments/model_training.py

# Package for distribution
uv build
uv publish  # To PyPI or private index
```

### Web Development (HTML/CSS/JS + Python Backend)

```bash
# Initialize full-stack project with UV backend
uv init --name webapp-backend
cd webapp-backend

# Add web framework and dependencies
uv add fastapi uvicorn[standard] jinja2 python-multipart
uv add --dev pytest-asyncio httpx

# Frontend assets (separate from UV)
mkdir static templates
# Use Live Server extension for HTML/CSS/JS development
# Right-click on HTML file and select "Open with Live Server"

# Run development server
uv run uvicorn main:app --reload --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000

# Production deployment
uv run gunicorn main:app -w 4 -k uvicorn.workers.UvicornWorker
```

## Architecture Patterns

### UV-First Agentic Development Framework

Clean separation of concerns with UV at the core:

- **`.claude/`** - Claude Code native integration (commands, agents, hooks, tools)
- **`pyproject.toml`** - UV project configuration and dependencies
- **`uv.lock`** - Reproducible dependency lockfile
- **`.python-version`** - Python version specification
- **`templates/`** - Reusable template system with variable substitution
- **`src/`** - Source code directory
- **`tests/`** - UV-managed test dependencies and files
- **`docs/`** - Documentation and examples

### Multi-Language Support (UV-Enhanced)

The framework supports:

- **Python development** - UV-first with lightning-fast package management
- **JavaScript/TypeScript projects** - npm/yarn alongside UV
- **Web development** - UV backend with static frontend assets
- **Scientific computing** - UV + Jupyter + data science stack
- **General scripting** - UV for Python, native tools for others

### Documentation-Driven Development

Comprehensive documentation structure includes:

- Technical architecture (`docs/ARCHITECTURE.md`)
- UV setup instructions (`docs/SETUP.md`)
- UV usage patterns (`docs/USAGE.md`)
- Feature documentation (`docs/FEATURES.md`)
- Contribution guidelines (`docs/CONTRIBUTING.md`)

### Framework Organization

- **Commands** in `.claude/commands/` - Claude Code slash commands
- **Tools** in `.claude/tools/` - Auto-fix engines, UV integrations
- **Agents** in `.claude/agents/` - Specialized agent definitions
- **Templates** in `templates/builders/` - Clean template system
- **Hooks** in `.claude/hooks/` - UV workflow automation
- **UV Configuration** in `pyproject.toml` - Modern Python project config

## Key Features

- Zero-configuration UV setup for new Python developers
- Lightning-fast automated package management with caching
- Performance-optimized VS Code settings with UV integration
- **Modular template system** with variable substitution
- **Command automation** for UV-powered development workflows
- **Enterprise-grade documentation** generation
- **🚀 REVOLUTIONARY: Review-driven implementation system**
- **🤖 Automated code improvement** with intelligent analysis
- **🔧 Auto-fix engine** for security and performance issues
- **⚡ UV-First Python**: 10-100x faster than pip/Poetry/PDM
- Multi-project workspace support with UV monorepo capabilities
- Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux)
- **🔒 Reproducible builds** with UV lockfiles and hashing
- **🐍 Modern Python toolchain** - UV + Ruff + mypy integration

## Claude Code Behavioral Guidelines

### Decision Making

- **When plans exist, execute them** - Check ROADMAP.md, validation checklists, and documentation first
- **Only ask for direction when plans are unclear or missing** - Don't create decision paralysis when next steps are documented
- **Follow the "Great Planning = Great Prompting" principle** - Respect existing planning work

### Execution Priority

1. Check existing plans/roadmaps/documentation
2. If clear next step exists, proceed immediately
3. Only prompt for direction when genuinely ambiguous

### Systematic File Creation (CRITICAL)

**NEVER output important analysis, frameworks, or actionable information solely in chat. Always create permanent files for knowledge that should be preserved, referenced, or acted upon.**

#### Mandatory File Creation Triggers

**Before providing substantial content, STOP and create files FIRST if ANY of these apply:**

- Analysis requiring >3 paragraphs of explanation
- Any framework or architecture description  
- Step-by-step processes with >5 steps
- Multiple interconnected concepts or solutions
- Information that took >10 minutes of thinking to develop
- Problem definitions → `ISSUES/{Problem-Name}.md`
- Solution frameworks → `FRAMEWORK/{Solution-Name}-Architecture.md`
- Implementation plans → `PROCESS/{Process-Name}-Implementation.md`
- Success criteria → `METRICS/{Area-Name}-Success-Criteria.md`
- Behavioral guidelines → `BEHAVIORAL/{Guideline-Name}-Guidelines.md`
- Analysis results → `ANALYSIS/{Topic-Name}-Analysis.md`

#### File Creation Workflow

1. **Recognize trigger** - Check if content meets file creation criteria
2. **Create appropriate file** with descriptive naming and proper structure
3. **Provide chat summary** - Brief overview with file reference
4. **Track with TodoWrite** - Include file creation in task management

#### Chat vs. File Decision Matrix

- **Chat appropriate**: Quick clarifications, status updates, simple confirmations
- **File required**: Problem analysis, solution frameworks, implementation plans, success metrics, behavioral guidelines, process workflows

**Reference:** See `BEHAVIORAL/Systematic-File-Creation-Guidelines.md` for complete implementation details.

## Getting Started with UV

1. **Install UV**: `curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh` (or Windows PowerShell installer)
2. **Open workspace**: `code code.code-workspace` in VS Code
3. **Initialize UV project**: `uv init` (creates pyproject.toml, .python-version)
4. **Claude Code auto-loads** project context via session hooks
5. **Start development**: `uv add requests` → `uv run python src/main.py`
6. **Enhanced review**: `/review --auto --fix` for intelligent analysis
7. **Context loading**: `/prime --full` for comprehensive understanding
8. **Documentation**: `/process-template --template=prd-builder.md`

### Quick Start Tour (UV + pyproject.toml First)

```bash
# Install UV (one-time setup)
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

# Create new project with pyproject.toml structure
uv init my-awesome-project
cd my-awesome-project

# pyproject.toml is automatically created with:
# - [project] section for metadata and dependencies
# - [tool.uv] section for UV-specific configuration
# - [build-system] section for packaging

# Add dependencies (updates pyproject.toml automatically)
uv add fastapi uvicorn requests pandas

# Add development dependencies to [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]
uv add --dev pytest black ruff mypy

# Add optional dependency groups
uv add --group docs sphinx sphinx-rtd-theme
uv add --group test pytest-cov httpx

# Install all dependencies from pyproject.toml
uv sync  # Installs [project.dependencies] + [tool.uv.dev-dependencies]

# Run your application (using project environment automatically)
uv run python src/main.py

# Development workflow with pyproject.toml tools
uv run pytest              # Run tests
uv run ruff check .        # Lint code  
uv run ruff format .       # Format code
uv run mypy src/           # Type check

# Generate/sync lockfile from pyproject.toml
uv lock    # Creates uv.lock with exact versions
uv sync --frozen  # Install exact lockfile versions (CI/production)

# === Claude Code Integration ===
# Load context and understand the project
/prime --full

# Run enhanced review with automation  
/review --auto --fix

# Process templates for documentation
/process-template --template=prd-builder.md

# === Legacy Compatibility (when needed) ===
# Export pyproject.toml dependencies to requirements.txt (for legacy systems)
uv export --format requirements-txt > requirements.txt

# One-time migration from existing requirements.txt to pyproject.toml
uv add $(cat requirements.txt | grep -v "^#" | grep -v "^$" | xargs)
```

## UV Installation Reference

### Universal Installation (Recommended)

```bash
# macOS and Linux
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

# Windows PowerShell  
powershell -c "irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex"

# Verify installation
uv --version
```

### Alternative Installation Methods

```bash
# Package managers
brew install uv                    # macOS Homebrew
pacman -S uv                      # Arch Linux  
sudo apt install uv               # Ubuntu/Debian (after adding Astral repo)
dnf install uv                    # Fedora/RHEL

# Python-based (bootstrapping)
pip install uv                    # Using pip
pipx install uv                   # Using pipx (isolated)

# From source (development)
cargo install --git https://github.com/astral-sh/uv
```

### Post-Installation Setup

```bash
# Add to shell profile for PATH (if not automatic)
echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc

# Verify and configure
uv --version
uv python list                    # List available Python versions
uv python install 3.11           # Install preferred Python version

# Global configuration (optional)
export UV_CACHE_DIR=~/.cache/uv
export UV_PYTHON_PREFERENCE=only-managed
```

# Project Workspace

## Overview

This is a development workspace initialized for VS Code with optimizations and best practices. It provides a solid foundation for various types of development projects with pre-configured settings, recommended extensions, and organized structure.

## 🚀 Quick Start

```bash
# Navigate to the workspace
cd f:\home\claude\code

# Open in VS Code
code code.code-workspace
```

VS Code will prompt you to install recommended extensions automatically.

## 📁 Project Structure

- [`.vscode/`](.vscode/) - VS Code specific settings and configurations
- [`src/`](src/) - Source code directory
- [`docs/`](docs/) - Documentation and guides
- [`tests/`](tests/) - Test files and utilities

## 📚 Documentation

| Document                                 | Description                                          |
| ---------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Setup Guide](docs/SETUP.md)**         | Detailed installation and configuration instructions |
| **[Usage Guide](docs/USAGE.md)**         | How to use the workspace for different project types |
| **[Features](docs/FEATURES.md)**         | Complete list of workspace features and capabilities |
| **[Contributing](docs/CONTRIBUTING.md)** | Guidelines for contributing to the project           |
| **[Roadmap](ROADMAP.md)**                | Future plans and development milestones              |
| **[Changelog](CHANGELOG.md)**            | Version history and release notes                    |

## ⚡ Key Features

- ✅ Auto-save enabled (1-second delay)
- ✅ Format on save with Prettier
- ✅ Optimized VS Code settings
- ✅ Comprehensive .gitignore
- ✅ Multi-language support
- ✅ Recommended extensions

## �️ Supported Development

- **JavaScript/TypeScript** - Node.js applications and web development
- **Python** - Scripts and applications with virtual environment support
- **Web Development** - HTML, CSS, JavaScript with Live Server
- **General Scripting** - Bash, configuration files, and more

## 🤝 Contributing

We welcome contributions! Please read our [Contributing Guidelines](docs/CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to get started.

## 📋 Next Steps

1. **New to this workspace?** Start with the [Setup Guide](docs/SETUP.md)
2. **Ready to develop?** Check the [Usage Guide](docs/USAGE.md)
3. **Want to contribute?** Read the [Contributing Guidelines](docs/CONTRIBUTING.md)
4. **Curious about features?** Browse the [Features Documentation](docs/FEATURES.md)

---

**Version:** 0.2.0 | **Last Updated:** August 2, 2025

{
  "name": "rdis-test-suite",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Comprehensive testing suite for Review-Driven Implementation System",
  "private": true,
  "scripts": {
    "test": "jest",
    "test:unit": "jest --selectProjects unit",
    "test:integration": "cross-env TEST_TYPE=integration jest",
    "test:e2e": "cross-env TEST_TYPE=e2e jest",
    "test:performance": "cross-env TEST_TYPE=performance jest",
    "test:security": "cross-env TEST_TYPE=security jest",
    "test:coverage": "jest --coverage",
    "test:watch": "jest --watch",
    "test:ci": "jest --ci --coverage --watchAll=false",
    "test:smoke": "jest --testNamePattern=\"smoke\"",
    "test:critical": "jest --testNamePattern=\"critical\"",
    "test:debug": "node --inspect-brk node_modules/.bin/jest --runInBand",
    "lint:tests": "eslint tests/rdis/**/*.js",
    "format:tests": "prettier --write tests/rdis/**/*.js",
    "validate": "npm run lint:tests && npm run test:ci",
    "benchmark": "node tests/rdis/performance/benchmark-runner.js",
    "security-scan": "node tests/rdis/security/security-scanner.js",
    "generate-report": "node tests/rdis/helpers/report-generator.js",
    "clean": "rimraf tests/rdis/reports/* tests/rdis/coverage/*",
    "setup": "node tests/rdis/helpers/test-environment-setup.js"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.22.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.22.0",
    "@types/jest": "^29.5.0",
    "@types/node": "^20.0.0",
    "@types/supertest": "^2.0.12",
    "babel-jest": "^29.5.0",
    "chai": "^4.3.7",
    "cross-env": "^7.0.3",
    "eslint": "^8.42.0",
    "eslint-plugin-jest": "^27.2.0",
    "jest": "^29.5.0",
    "jest-html-reporters": "^3.1.4",
    "mocha": "^10.2.0",
    "nyc": "^15.1.0",
    "prettier": "^2.8.8",
    "rimraf": "^5.0.1",
    "sinon": "^15.2.0",
    "supertest": "^6.3.3"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "benchmark": "^2.1.4",
    "memory-usage": "^0.2.4",
    "clinic": "^11.0.0",
    "autocannon": "^7.12.0",
    "wiremock": "^2.35.1"
  },
  "jest": {
    "projects": [
      {
        "displayName": "unit",
        "testMatch": ["<rootDir>/tests/rdis/unit/**/*.test.js"],
        "setupFilesAfterEnv": ["<rootDir>/tests/rdis/helpers/test-setup.js"]
      },
      {
        "displayName": "integration",

    "claude-code"

}
